creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell, Charles H. Bell, and Samuel H. Bell
description: Ladle; fluted bowl and bright cut engraving on handle; urn shaped shield engraved on end of handle
text: This pair of ladles demonstrates an evolution in eighteenth-century serving utensils in Boston and Philadelphia. The Revere spoon's shell bowl showcases a popular neoclassical motif and was raised in the traditional manner. In contrast, the smooth bowl of Lownes's ladle was first cast and then applied to a sleek raised handle. Both display bright-cut and engraved decoration on their handles, also favored during this era.
title: Soup ladle
